content.description: FA was lead ground up by Cyrena Goodrich. A good warm up for AZ Flyways. Getting to the first bolt is a tad exciting and you don't want to fall off. A small bolt adjustment thanks to the direct start means you can now climb straight up to east face without actually stopping on the big ledge which means it flows better.
content.location: Left edge of the north face which has a large ledge half way up.

content.description: Mid way up there is a toss.  The rest is mighty small sharp crimps on steep rock.
content.location: Left end of the South face.

content.description: This direct start to Miss Adventure has these things going for it. First: it has another crux right at the start. Second: You can start it at the same level as Arizona Flyways. Third: it leads you up the blunt arete and keeps you left at the big ledge which keeps it more sustained and maintains the flow. Fourth: You still get the best part of Miss Adventure. Fifth: you get an airy run to the clipping jugs at the anchors.
content.location: Right edge of the overhanging east face of Anduriel Tower. Ten feet right of Flyways.

content.description: Thin face to tough move over small overlap.
content.location: Anduriel Tower in the Punch and Judy Towers area.  Climb the center of the S. face.

climbs.name: Birthday Girl
climbs.fa: Kevin Carmichael, Tejal Parikh, John Fowler, EFR

content.description: Traverse right and up all the way to the arete then back left into dihedral.  Varied climbing makes this a great route.  There is a funky toaster sized block that needs to be busted off but there is a good hold just above it so you can pulling or standing on it.
content.location: Bolts in the slab are for Bubblenutz. Drop down the north side of Anduriel Tower which is closest to Punch and Judy parking spot. Â About 15 feet left of AZ Flyways is the first bolt of a new start. This new start avoids the slab belay and allows the belayer to keep the climber in sight almost the entire time. 70 meter reaches the ground with a lot to spare. Tie a knot if you are using a 60M.

climbs.name: Arizona Flyways
climbs.fa: Eric Fazio-Rhicard, Scott Ayers, Mike Head

content.description: Looking for mid 11 sport? This is one of the best ones to do and has been a good project for many climbers in the past. Face climb edges through several bolts to thin crack w/ small flats and up a few more bolts to a slightly more vertical section where it is possible to rest. Up and left on a couple of larger holds, decide whether to go straight up or cut left around corner and up to ledge (anchors).
content.protection:
Bolts, Chains

 Bolts and top-anchors updated by CASA in 2016.
content.location: Located on the south toe of the tower.
